title: If no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description: When starting a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed and accessing a URL, the server is returning an HTTP code 200 OK with no content, instead of the expected HTTP error 404. This behavior is observed when using the Apache Tomcat 7.0.0 beta release.
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server returns HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
EB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server should return an HTTP error 404 page, indicating that the requested resource was not found.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Download the Apache Tomcat 7.0.0 beta release from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip  2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed. 3. Access a URL on the Tomcat server.
